BUREAU OF CIVIL AVIATION SECURITY 
(MINISTRY OF CIVIL AVIATION) 
GOVERNMENT OF INDIA 
‘A’ WING, JANPATH BHAWAN, 
JANPATH, NEW DELHI 
 
 
 
 
       DATED: 10.11.2008 
 
AVSEC ORDER NO.  04/ 2008 
 
Subject: Protection of Security matters at Foreign Airports: 
 
 
Commissioner of Security (Civil Aviation), Bureau of Civil Aviation Security 
(BCAS), in exercise of powers conferred by Section 5A of Aircraft Act 1934 
delegated to him vide Government of India, Ministry of Civil Aviation Notification 
No. 1797 dated July 3, 1997 for the purpose of securing the safety of aircraft 
operations, directs that: 
 
(i) 
In order to ensure adequate security of Indian air carriers operations and 
secret/ security information handled by them, it is essential that the private 
agencies working with Indian air carriers, on outsource basis or otherwise,  at 
foreign stations should not be allowed to handle secret/ security information by 
any means, for instance through papers or IT systems. 
 
(ii) 
IT systems at all foreign airports served by Indian air carriers shall be 
properly protected by the concerned staff of Indian air carriers to prevent leakage 
of any secret/ security information to such agencies working with them. 
 
(iii) 
All secret/ security information shall be graded as per the Official Secret 
Act and the National Civil Aviation Security Programme/ Airlines Security 
Programme and proper record thereof shall be maintained regularly/ constantly. 
 
(iv) 
Unauthorized access by any private agencies to the secret/ security 
information of airlines shall be strictly dealt with and the concerned air-carrier 
shall be held responsible for such lapses. 
 
 
 
(M. Malaviya) 
Addl. Commissioner of Security (CA)
